message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

This paper focuses on group activity recognition using deep models and proposes a flexible and efficient Actor Relation Graph (ARG) to capture the appearance and position relation between actors. The paper extensively uses computer vision techniques such as Graph Convolutional Networks and spatially localized ARG. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the end-to-end learning of ARG, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel approach to sparsify ARG, which could be related to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also evaluates its proposed method on two standard group activity recognition datasets, which could be related to the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the visualization of learned actor graphs and relation features, which could be related to the sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
